channel.title: A very simple question
channel.description:
Basically, when a player gos onto a certain coordinate, I want something to happen. I would little to no lagg emitted from this process, though.
Please refer me to the function which can do this (if there is one), or help me by teaching me how to do it manually.
Also, If you can't figure it out, Another suggestion would be finding out when a player is standing on a certain object. I'm sure that this would cause a little less lagg (rather then a constant timer checking if a player is on a coordinate [this made me lagg tonnes]).
Thank you guys very much in advance. (Just so you know, I'm making a minigame :P).
Edit: I forgot to state that I'm using a Project Insanity base (I'm used to delta and czar; but I'm finding PI much better, In almost every way).

item.title: A very simple question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

external hard drive= more space on computer. more space on computer= less processes. less processes= faster computer and less lag.
and my 2nd post. ive seen people add a posion timer or something with the poision hit, and they changed what object hits it and changed the timer of the hit.

Read full topic

item.title: A very simple question
item.dc:creator: @bird1 bird_
item.description:
@bird1 wrote:

@collide: I will keep trying

@sk8r: I know that, but I’m trying to make the server not lagg for anyone. +how will a hard drive help you :P. I was thinking of more RAM.

RAM fixes everything.

@sk8r [2nd post]: I don’t think that will help me very much. Mainly because I’m trying to figure out when you get hit (nothing to do with anything else :P).

Read full topic

item.title: A very simple question

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

if you are adding that. i think the objects that hit you need to deal with something that has to do with like when you get hit with poision.

item.title: A very simple question
item.dc:creator: @collide collide
item.description:
@collide wrote:

[quote=“bird_, post:8, topic:378846”]Yeah, It would ruin the idea :P.

Basically, I’m using the pyramid as a kind of fortress. On some of the walls are these blocks that go in and out. If you’re standing on the position of where the block hits, I want you to get hurt a bit (like every second).

There is also going to be numerous high-leveled monsters inside. Basically, you need to get a killcount and then you can enter the bosses chamber whom drops very rare items.

Dont steal my idea xD.[/quote]

Very nice idea, I don’t plan to, I got an original source :p. Well not so much anymore but ye xD. Keep trying at the idea, when it works and there’s little bugs you may have made something amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: A very simple question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

bird_:

I’ve just noticed all that. No idea what to do now… Other then trying to make the timer not lagg.

the timer laggs because it has to update. theres no stoping that. unless you buy a new computer, or like an exeternal hard drive.

Read full topic

item.title: A very simple question
item.dc:creator: @bird1 bird_
item.description:
@bird1 wrote:

Yeah, It would ruin the idea :P.

Basically, I’m using the pyramid as a kind of fortress. On some of the walls are these blocks that go in and out. If you’re standing on the position of where the block hits, I want you to get hurt a bit (like every second).

There is also going to be numerous high-leveled monsters inside. Basically, you need to get a killcount and then you can enter the bosses chamber whom drops very rare items.

Dont steal my idea xD.

i dont think you can do it for when they are on the object. i think you have to make it so you have to click it, use something on something. along those basis

item.title: A very simple question
item.dc:creator: @collide collide
item.description:
@collide wrote:

I wouldn’t have a clue how to do this, but this is just a simple stab in the dark…

I’d expect if you wanted something to happen to a player when he stands on a coord, that something happened, then that’d be an ActionHandler and then of course you’d have to declare that case etc.

Read full topic
